definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: As I reached the ticket barrier, the train was just drawing in .
sentences.chinese: 當我到驗票處時，火車剛進站。

sentences.english: Show your ticket at the barrier before you board the train.
sentences.chinese: 上火車前先在進站口的驗票處出示你的車票。

sentences.english: The ticket-collector suddenly appeared and opened the gate .
sentences.chinese: 驗票人突然出現並打開了大門。

sentences.english: The visitors need to be quartic tickets checking during an entire journey, Please keep the face clean and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆參觀全程需驗票四次，請保持票面清潔平整。

sentences.english: Entrance permit began one hour ahead of time, and please accept security check.
sentences.chinese: 提前一小時開始驗票入場，請接受安全檢查。

sentences.english: Please hold your ticket and check it through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 乘客們，魯班路站到了，請手持車票經過閘機驗票。

sentences.english: Could you please tell me where we show our tickets?
sentences.chinese: 請告訴我我們在哪兒驗票好嗎？
公交車現在都是自動驗票了。

sentences.english: Also, we believe that we will respect the results of the recount .
sentences.chinese: 而且，我相信我們會尊重驗票的結果。

sentences.english: Insert your ticket into slot located above the green arrow on the fare gate.
sentences.chinese: 將車票插入驗票口綠色箭頭上方的進票插口。

sentences.english: At the exit, you are required to give it to the ticket- checker.
sentences.chinese: 在出站口，您要把車票交給驗票員查看。

sentences.english: That is not blindfold worship of foreign things but learn from what is best in foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 我在想，這種沒有驗票的做法目前在中國是行不通的。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
